instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_FAN_0_CTL: What is SMC_FAN_0_CTL? SMC_FAN_0_CTL is a line between the SMC and the fan that controls fan speed that is frequently disturbed when someone inexperienced knocks resistors in the area off with their fingernail or screwdriver when unplugging the fan. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots but no fan spin
threads.message:
This one was liquid damaged, the keyboard backlight connector was the only visible damage, apart from that it boots fine, but no fan spin.

Measured <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> it has:
Pin 1 - 3.37mv on gate 
Pin 2 - 3.3v on source
Pin 3 - 3.37mv on drain

Swapped it out but same measurements.

<RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR> is good.

What should I be getting on <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots but no fan spin
threads.message: The fan does not spin until it gets hot, stress it and see if fan spins....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots but no fan spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4757"]The fan does not spin until it gets hot, stress it and see if fan spins....[/QUOTE]

Is that true? Every other machine I have worked on, the fan starts with POST. Anyway not the issue here, I thinking <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> should be higher and my SMC maybe the issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots but no fan spin
threads.message: Newer machines only spin up when warm.
